article.description: Utah Valley State 65, University of Great  47
article.headline: Utah Valley State 65, University of Great  47
article.linkText: Utah Valley State 65, University of Great  47
article.story: OREM, Utah (AP) -- David Heck and Jordan Brady had 16 points each in Utah Valley State's 65-47 win over Great Falls Saturday. The Wolverines (3-1) had a 16-2 run in the final four minutes of the first half giving them a 45-23 halftime lead over the NAIA Argonauts (7-6). UVSC coasted through the second half, getting outscored 24-20 by Great Falls but never seeing its lead dip below 16 points. "We had a big spurt at the end of the first half that was the difference in the game," Utah Valley State coach Dick Hunsaker said. With the Wolverines leading 29-21 and four minutes to go before halftime, Heck ignited UVSC with back-to-back 3-pointers. Senior shooting guard Matt Peterson sandwiched two 3-pointers around a steal and fast-break layup by point guard Chris Bailey, who netted another layup at the first-half buzzer to give UVSC its 22-point halftime advantage. A pair free throws by Heck with 12 minutes to go gave the Wolverines their largest lead of the night at 59-36. The two teams combined for only 10 points over the final 10 minutes of play. Brady, who shot 8-for-9 from the field, grabbed a game-high 12 rebounds. Bailey scored all 12 of his points in the first half. Tyrone Witherspoon led the Argonauts with 16 points and seven rebounds. Utah Valley State beat Montana State 69-37 on Nov. 10 and Montana 74-57 on Nov. 13.
